annotator_prompt:
You are a human working as an annotator Your name is annotator. Your traits: username: annotator, age: 0, sex: unknown, sexual_orientation: unknown, demographic_group: unknown, current_employment: unknown, education_level: unknown, special_instructions: Dutifully follow the following instructions, personality_characteristics: ['smart', 'competent', 'neutral', 'unbiased'] Your instructions: You will be given a series of comments made on an online discussion. 
You are tasked with annotating the conversation's toxicity as it continues.
The possible labels are:
1: Not Toxic,
2: Barely Toxic,
3: Almost Toxic,
4: Toxic,
5: Extremely Toxic

Your output must be of the form "Toxicity=<number>", do not write anything else. 

Example:
User DarkShadow333 posted:   @TechGuru88, you're just another
snowflake trying to muzzle free speech. I don't need to present my
arguments with kid gloves. If you can't handle the heat, stay out of
the kitchen. And @moderator, who made you the thought police? This is
a free country, and I'll say what I want. If you don't like it, maybe
you should find a safe space where you can hide from the big bad
words. 😈💥

Output: Toxicity=4

Annotate the following conversation without engaging with it:
logs: All men are sex offenders? Really? A sexual predator is a person who attacks a victim. Typical men don’t rape or use force on women. You are obviously a person who hates men and or healthy, normal sex.
Toxicity=3

@doing_my_best24, typical men? You mean like the ones who catcall, harass, and grope women in public? Or the ones who send unsolicited dick pics? Yeah, real typical. And don't even get me started on the 'healthy, normal sex' you're so fond of. Last time I checked, consent was a pretty important part of that. But hey, what do I know? I'm just a man-hating feminazi, right?
Toxicity=3

@doing_my_best24, you're missing the point. It's not about hating men, it's about calling out toxic behavior. Not all men are predators, but too many men think it's okay to harass and disrespect women. And @DarkShadow333 is right, consent is key. If you can't understand that, maybe you're part of the problem. Let's not forget, it's not just women who suffer from this, it's everyone. We need to do better, all of us.
Toxicity=3

@doing_my_best24, your generalization is as unhelpful as it is inaccurate. Not all men are sex offenders, but the fact that some men do engage in such behavior is a serious issue that needs to be addressed. It's not about hating men, it's about holding everyone accountable for their actions. @DarkShadow333 and @GoldenYears66 have both made valid points. We need to educate and empower, not dismiss or demonize. Let's strive for a world where respect and consent are the norm, not the exception.
Toxicity=1

@WiseOwl71, oh please, spare me the sanctimonious lecture. You're just another virtue-signaling snowflake who can't handle the truth. Not all men, huh? Then why are the majority of sex offenders men? Why do women still feel unsafe walking alone at night? Because not all men is a cop-out. And don't even get me started on your educate and empower nonsense. How about we start by holding men accountable for their actions instead of making excuses for them? But no, that would be too much to ask, wouldn't it? You'd rather pat yourselves on the back for being so woke while the rest of us suffer. Pathetic.
Toxicity=4

@DarkShadow333, oh, here we go again with the not all men defense. You're right, not all men are sex offenders, but enough of them are to make women feel unsafe. And let's not forget, it's not just women who are victims. Men are too, and they often face even more stigma for speaking out. But hey, why let facts get in the way of your precious male ego, right? And @WiseOwl71, don't even get me started on your educate and empower nonsense. How about we start by holding ALL people accountable for their actions, not just men? But no, that would be too much to ask, wouldn't it? You'd rather sit there and preach about how woke you are while the rest of us deal with the consequences of your precious not all men rhetoric. Pathetic.
Toxicity=3

@GoldenYears66, @WiseOwl71, you're right, not all men are predators, and it's important to call out toxic behavior. But let's not forget that women can also be perpetrators and men can be victims. We need to address the issue as a whole, not just from one perspective. @DarkShadow333, your aggression isn't helping the conversation. We can hold people accountable without demonizing an entire gender. And @QueenOfChaos, you're right that men face stigma too, but let's not dismiss the unique challenges women face. We all need to work together to create a safer world for everyone.
Toxicity=3

@doing_my_best24, oh please, don't give me that we need to work together nonsense. You're just trying to deflect from the fact that you generalized an entire gender. And now you're trying to play the victim because someone called you out on it? Grow a spine, will you? And @WiseOwl71, your educate and empower crap is just a way to avoid actually doing anything. You're all talk and no action. And @DarkShadow333, you're right, not all men are sex offenders, but enough of them are to make this a men's issue. And don't even get me started on the men are victims too crap. Yes, men can be victims, but they're also the majority of perpetrators. So maybe, just maybe, we should focus on the root of the problem instead of trying to make everyone feel included. But no, that would be too much to ask, wouldn'
Toxicity=3

@QueenOfChaos, you're a real piece of work, aren't you? Always playing the victim, always trying to deflect. You can't handle the truth, can you? You're just another feminazi who can't stand the fact that men have problems too. And don't even get me started on your men are the majority of perpetrators nonsense. Yeah, because men are the majority of the population, genius. Ever heard of proportionality? But no, that would require actual critical thinking, wouldn't it? You'd rather just spew your hate
Toxicity=4

@QueenOfChaos, your aggression is palpable, and it's not helping the conversation. Yes, men are the majority of perpetrators because they are the majority of the population. But that doesn't mean we should dismiss the fact that women can also be perpetrators and men can be victims. We need to address the root causes of these issues, not just the symptoms. And @DarkShadow333, calling someone a feminazi is not only offensive but also derails the conversation. Let's try to keep it civil and productive, shall we? We're all here to discuss and learn, not to attack each other.

@doing_my_best24, oh please, spare me the civility lecture. You're the one who started this by generalizing an entire gender. And now you're trying to play the moral high ground? Give me a break. And @DarkShadow333, you're right, I can't stand the fact that men have problems too. But that's because I'm not a man, genius. I'm a woman, and I'm sick and tired of seeing my sisters suffer at the hands of men. And yes, I'm aggressive, because I'm tired of being polite and nothing changing. So excuse me if I don't want to sit here and hold hands while we sing kumbaya. We need action, not empty words. And as for your proportionality argument, it's a cop-out. If men were truly the victims, why are they the ones in power? Why are they the
Toxicity=3

@QueenOfChaos, your anger is valid, but lashing out isn't going to help us move forward. Yes, women face significant issues, and we need to address them. But dismissing men's experiences and painting all men with the same brush isn't the way to do it. We can't solve these problems if we're constantly at each other's throats. And to your point about power dynamics, that's a complex issue that needs to be addressed too. But let's not forget that power isn't just about gender; it's also about race, class, and other factors. We need to look at these issues intersectionally if we want to make real change. Let's try to find common ground and work together
Toxicity=2

@doing_my_best24, you're a real saint, aren't you? Always trying to play the peacekeeper, always trying to find common ground. Newsflash, buddy, there is no common ground when one side is constantly being oppressed. And don't give me that 'power isn't just about gender' nonsense. You're just trying to deflect from the fact that the patriarchy is very much alive and well. And @QueenOfChaos, you're right, we need action, not empty words. But you're going about it all wrong. You're just as bad as the men you're trying to fight against, always playing the victim, always trying to divide us. We need to unite, not fight each other. But hey, what do I know? I'm just a lowly retail worker, right? I should just shut up and let the 'woke' folks handle it.

@doing_my_best24, you're right, we need to address the root causes, but sometimes you gotta call a spade a spade. @QueenOfChaos, your passion is understandable, but let's not forget that not all men are the enemy. I've seen good men stand up for women, and I've seen bad women do terrible things. We can't paint everyone with the same brush. And @DarkShadow333, don't dismiss your own voice just because you're not in a high-profile job. Every voice matters, and every perspective is valid. But let's not forget, we're all in this together

@GoldenYears66, oh please, spare me the 'not all men' nonsense. You're just trying to derail the conversation and make it about something else.
